title.narrative: Inspired Mass of People that Advance Community Transformation (IMPACT-Southern Philippines)

description.narrative: This project will improve the quality of life of 780 (260 original and 520 pass-on) needy families in Southern Philippines through Heifer’s Values-Based Holistic Community Development approach. Families will be organized into 12 original self-help groups (SHGs) and 24 pass-on SHGs. Original families will receive 480 dairy goats, 10 bucks, 100 breeding gilts, 200 piglets and four boars. Other inputs will include 32.5 kilograms of vegetable seeds, 1,300 kilograms of crop seeds, 13,000 banana plantlets and 2,000 tree seedlings. Through these livestock and crops, families will have increased income and savings and improved nutritional status. Groups will also serve as resource villages for livestock in the area. Families will be taught to produce and mix their own feeds. Two hammer mills will be provided for this purpose. Community Animal Health Workers will be trained to provide basic services on animal health and breeding.Heifer’s 12 Cornerstones will be at the heart of this project to promote Passing on the Gift and to enhance the relationships of men and women at the family and community level. The project will further increase the capacity of families and groups through a series of trainings on group formation and savings, improved animal management, natural resource management, sustainable agriculture, income-generating activities and co-learning among project participants. The participation of local government units at the Barangay and municipal levels will be maximized. Other support groups and government line agencies will be tapped to provide social and technical services to the project and to take charge of developing their own community.
